name: Sang Bui
about: I am software engineer.  I solve problems using software. I have experience making software in web development, Android development, and some iOS development.  In addition, I have worked in devOps.  I am interested in all things Computer Science.  As a result, I have read about topics such as OOP, functional programming, computer graphics, compilers, encryptions, game development, neural networks, and reinforcement learning. Lastly, I enjoyed learning about Math; I have studied Discrete Math, Linear Algebra, and Category Theory
summary: In 2011, I didn't know OOP, Java, C++, or game development tools. In 2014, I didn't know about JavaScript, Node or its ecosystem; web, iOS, or Android development. In 2016, I didn't know about React/Redux or functional programming. In 2017, I didn't know about Neural Nets or Reinforcement Learning. My biggest asset is not the languages or skills I had the pleasure of learning, but what I could learn.  Learning new programming paradigms, tools, and languages is my best skill.

experiences.description: Code review for other developers. Defined product requirements and creates high-level architectural specifications, ensuring feasibility and functionality for a full web application. Architect a web application with React/Redux, python backend, Kerbereros Single Sign On Authentication system. Created Base of Estimate on how many hours/cost future project will take. Developed software and follows the company SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle), which includes Agile/Scrum sprint tasking and management using Jira/Gitlab. Worked on a Situational Awareness Web Application.  Help created a Selenium testing suite.

education.degree: Master of Science in Computer Science
education.description: I refined my background in Computer Science. I study deeply about data structures, algorithms, operating systems, databases, and software engineering.  I picked up SQL, JavaScript, Java for Android, and Swift for iOS.

I learn about Java, C++, and C# to make games.  I used OpenGL, DirectX, and Unity game engine. Since I graduated, I have not work in the game industry at all; however, I still retained some of those skills.  Unfortunately, I have not update my resume for game development; however, I could probably refresh myself if needed.
